node.title: FV elemental vs qp evaluation

node.bodyText:
Hello
Both formulations are equivalent in terms of results for a finite volume variable.
The element argument on a constant monomial gets the cell-center value, which is also the only quadrature point in a FV simulation (_qp = 0).
The first formulation would be a tad faster (possibly not measurable), as it's a more lightweight interface
The second formulation (using the functor routines) will let you use functions, variables, functor material properties and soon postprocessors for mag_x and _y.
@lindsayad
As you prefer basically!
Guillaume

Thanks, Guillaume. That is what I was guessing. Incidentally, I did write postprocessors for the FV code but had to use ADFunctorElementalAux and ADFunctorElementalGradientAux to define elemental variables and their gradients that I could use with the ElementIntegralPostprocessor, so postprocessors that can use the FV variables directly will be great!
It's coming real soon! Josh has fixed a legacy issues with postprocessors and now we are on the brink of having that
That will be great!

I will say that I think it's easier to support finite volume with the functor interfaces, e.g. makeElemArg. So we may develop FV features in the future that are only supported through the functor interfaces. But the _qp code that already exists will probably always be supported, as there is substantial user code that relies on it.

node.title: Building MOOSE in developer mode:
node.bodyText: Any web links to how I can build my moose app in developer mode? Do I have to re-install moose to do this?

Hello
You have to rebuild with the devel method
METHOD=devel make -j6
Guillaume

node.title: The requested AD material property 'stress' of type 'RankTwoTensorTempl<double>' is already retrieved or declared as a non-AD property of type 'RankTwoTensorTempl<double>'.
node.bodyText:
Hello All,
I’ve obtained stress as an AD Material property into my permeability model. But when I run my input file, I got the above error. What I’m I doing wrong?
This is how I obtained the stress:
   _stress(getADMaterialProperty<RankTwoTensor>("stress")),
   _strain(getADMaterialProperty<RankTwoTensor>("creep_strain"))

My input file looks something like this:
  [elasticity_tensor_fluid]
    type = ADComputeIsotropicElasticityTensor
    youngs_modulus = 1e11                  
    poissons_ratio = 0.0     
  []

  [return_stress]
    type = ADComputeMultipleInelasticStress
    inelastic_models = "new_creep"
    combined_inelastic_strain_weights = '1.0'
  []

  [new_creep]
    type = ADNewCreep
    smin = 1.21e8 
    smax = 1.88e5    
    smin_const = 0.87
    smax_const = 1.21
  []

Hello
Where is stress being declared?
There's a Debug option to show material properties , who is declaring and who is consuming
Guillaume

Hello, so I got a new error after I modified the constructor:
*** ERROR ***
The following error occurred in the object "stress_xx", of type "ADRankTwoScalarAux".

The requested AD material property 'stress' of type 'RankTwoTensorTempl<double>'
is already retrieved or declared as a non-AD property of type 'RankTwoTensorTempl<double>'.

The stress is being consumed by my new permeability model and I declared it in my header file as:
  /// get the AD of total stress tensor
	const ADMaterialProperty<RankTwoTensor>& _stress

In the source, it is:
   _stress(getADMaterialProperty<RankTwoTensor>("RR_stress")),
   _strain(getADMaterialProperty<RankTwoTensor>("RR_total_strain"))

My intention is to get the an ADstress from ADComputeMultipleInelasticStress into my permeability model.
Here is what the debug option is showing:
    domain: block 1 (52)
      Material Name:       temperature_neighbor
      Property Names:      "PorousFlow_grad_temperature_qp" "PorousFlow_temperature_qp" "dPorousFlow_grad_temperature_qp_dgradvar"
                             "dPorousFlow_grad_temperature_qp_dvar" "dPorousFlow_temperature_qp_dvar"

      Material Name:       water_viscosity_density_neighbor

                             "PorousFlow_fluid_phase_internal_energy_qp0" "PorousFlow_viscosity_qp0"

      Material Name:       PorousFlow_relative_permeability_nodal_all_neighbor
      Property Names:      "PorousFlow_relative_permeability_nodal" "dPorousFlow_relative_permeability_nodal_dvar"

      Material Name:       PorousFlow_density_nodal_all_neighbor
      Property Names:      "PorousFlow_fluid_phase_density_nodal" "dPorousFlow_fluid_phase_density_nodal_dvar"

      Material Name:       PorousFlow_viscosity_nodal_all_neighbor

      Material Name:       PorousFlow_enthalpy_nodal_all_neighbor
      Property Names:      "PorousFlow_fluid_phase_enthalpy_nodal" "dPorousFlow_fluid_phase_enthalpy_nodal_dvar"

      Material Name:       PorousFlow_internal_energy_nodal_all_neighbor
      Property Names:      "PorousFlow_fluid_phase_internal_energy_nodal" "dPorousFlow_fluid_phase_internal_energy_nodal_dvar"

      Material Name:       all_strain_neighbor
      Property Names:      "RR_mechanical_strain" "RR_rotation_increment" "RR_strain_increment" "RR_strain_rate"
                             "RR_total_strain"

And here is part of my input file where the problem might be:
[AuxVariables]
  [stress_xx]
    family = MONOMIAL
    order = CONSTANT
  []
  [stress_yy]
    family = MONOMIAL
    order = CONSTANT
  []
  [stress_zz]
    family = MONOMIAL
    order = CONSTANT
  []
  [porosity]
    family = MONOMIAL
    order = CONSTANT
  []
    [permeability]
    family = MONOMIAL
    order = CONSTANT
  []
[]


[AuxKernels]
  [stress_xx]
    type = RankTwoScalarAux
    variable = stress_xx
    rank_two_tensor = stress
    scalar_type = MinPrincipal
    point1 = '0 0 0'
    point2 = '0 0 1'
    execute_on = timestep_end
  []
  [stress_yy]
    type = RankTwoScalarAux
    variable = stress_yy
    rank_two_tensor = stress
    scalar_type = MidPrincipal
    point1 = '0 0 0'
    point2 = '0 0 1'
    execute_on = timestep_end
  []
  [porosity]
    type = PorousFlowPropertyAux
    variable = porosity
    property = porosity
    execute_on = timestep_end
  []
    [permeability]
    type = PorousFlowPropertyAux
    variable = permeability
    property = permeability
    execute_on = timestep_end
  []
[]


 [Modules/TensorMechanics/Master]
   [all]
    strain = SMALL
    incremental = true
    add_variables = true
    generate_output = 'stress_yy creep_strain_xx creep_strain_yy creep_strain_zz elastic_strain_yy'  
    use_automatic_differentiation = true
  []
[]

This looks like you have two stress models, one from the tensor mechanics action and one from one of your materials most probably
but I don’t see any called stress_xx
the auxvariable and auxkernels for output are not a problem

Hi. You’re right. It seems my StressDivergenceTensor Kernels are conflicting with my Tensor Mechanics Action. I fixed this by removing and replacing all stress divergence kernels, associated auxk and auxv by:
[Modules/TensorMechanics/Master]
  [Modules/TensorMechanics/Master]
    [Modules/TensorMechanics/Master]
    strain = SMALL
    incremental = true
    add_variables = true
    generate_output = 'stress_yy stress_xx stress_zz creep_strain_xx'  
    use_automatic_differentiation = true
    base_name = RR
  [block1]
  block = 'block1'
  []
  [block2]
   block = 'block2'
  []
  [block3]
   block = 'block3'
  []
    []
  []
[]

Now I’m getting this new error:
section '[Modules/TensorMechanics/Master/Modules/TensorMechanics]' does not have an associated "Action".
 Common causes:
- you misspelled the Action/section name
- the app you are running does not support this Action/syntax

This syntax is not valid. You're nesting plenty of things,
[Modules/TensorMechanics/Master]
  [Modules/TensorMechanics/Master]
    [Modules/TensorMechanics/Master]

it should be simpler than that

Yeah, I fixed that a while ago, it works but now I have an old error:
*** ERROR ***
The following error occurred in the object "RR_stress_yy_block1", of type "RankTwoCartesianComponent".

The requested non-AD material property 'RR_stress' of type 'RankTwoTensorTempl<double>'
is already retrieved or declared as a AD property of type 'RankTwoTensorTempl<double>'.

It seems I’m requesting a non-AD stress from TensorMechanicsAction but I’ve declared and retrieved the stress as an AD property in my perm model. Is there a way around it?

So, I went around it by passing use_automatic_differentiation = true to each block of the tensor mechanics action. But I’m getting a new error:
*** ERROR ***
The following error occurred in the object "MOOSE Problem", of type "FEProblem".

Material property 'stress', requested by 'permeability_block2' is not defined on block block2
Material property 'total_strain', requested by 'permeability_block2' is not defined on block block2
Material property 'stress', requested by 'permeability_block2_face' is not defined on block block2
Material property 'total_strain', requested by 'permeability_block2_face' is not defined on block block2
Material property 'stress', requested by 'permeability_block2_neighbor' is not defined on block block2
Material property 'total_strain', requested by 'permeability_block2_neighbor' is not defined on block block2
Material property 'stress', requested by 'permeability_block3' is not defined on block block3
Material property 'total_strain', requested by 'permeability_block3' is not defined on block block3
Material property 'stress', requested by 'permeability_block3_face' is not defined on block block3
Material property 'total_strain', requested by 'permeability_block3_face' is not defined on block block3
Material property 'stress', requested by 'permeability_block3_neighbor' is not defined on block block3
Material property 'total_strain', requested by 'permeability_block3_neighbor' is not defined on block block3
Material property 'stress', requested by 'permeability_block1' is not defined on block block1
Material property 'total_strain', requested by 'permeability_block1' is not defined on block block1
Material property 'stress', requested by 'permeability_block1_face' is not defined on block block1
Material property 'total_strain', requested by 'permeability_block1_face' is not defined on block block1
Material property 'stress', requested by 'permeability_block1_neighbor' is not defined on block block1
Material property 'total_strain', requested by 'permeability_block1_neighbor' is not defined on block block1

Part of my input file looks like:
[UserObjects]
 [dictator]
  type = PorousFlowDictator
  porous_flow_vars = 'ppressure disp_x disp_y disp_z'
  number_fluid_phases = 1
  number_fluid_components = 1
 []
 [pc]
  type = PorousFlowCapillaryPressureVG
  alpha = 1E-6
  m = 0.6
  []
[]

[GlobalParams]
  displacements = 'disp_x disp_y disp_z'
  gravity = '0 0 0'
  PorousFlowDictator = dictator
[]

  [FluidProperties]
    [water]
      type = SimpleFluidProperties
      bulk_modulus = 2e9
      density0 = 900
      viscosity = 7e-3
      thermal_expansion = 0
    []
  []

[Variables]
  [ppressure]       
    block = ' block1 block2' 
  []
[]

[AuxVariables]
    [darcy_vel_x]
    family = MONOMIAL
    order = CONSTANT
    block = ' block1 block2' 
  []
  [darcy_vel_y]
    family = MONOMIAL
    order = CONSTANT
    block = ' block1 block2' 
  []
  [darcy_vel_z]
    family = MONOMIAL
    order = CONSTANT
    block = ' block1 block2' 
  []
  [swater]
    family = MONOMIAL
    order = CONSTANT
    block = ' block1 block2' 
  []
  [porosity]
    family = MONOMIAL
    order = CONSTANT
  []
    [permeability]
    family = MONOMIAL
    order = CONSTANT
  []
[]

[AuxKernels]
    [darcy_vel_x]
    type = PorousFlowDarcyVelocityComponent
    component = x
    variable = darcy_vel_x
    fluid_phase = 0                            
    execute_on = TIMESTEP_END 
    block = ' block1 block2' 
  []
  [darcy_vel_y]
    type = PorousFlowDarcyVelocityComponent
    component = y
    variable = darcy_vel_y
    fluid_phase = 0                            
    execute_on = TIMESTEP_END
    block = ' block1 block2' 
  []
    [darcy_vel_z]
    type = PorousFlowDarcyVelocityComponent
    component = z
    variable = darcy_vel_z
    fluid_phase = 0                            
    execute_on = TIMESTEP_END
    block = ' block1 block2' 
  []
  [swater]
    type = PorousFlowPropertyAux
    variable = swater
    property = saturation
    phase = 0
    execute_on = timestep_end
    block = ' block1 block2' 
  []
  [porosity]
    type = PorousFlowPropertyAux
    variable = porosity
    property = porosity
    execute_on = timestep_end
  []
    [permeability]
    type = PorousFlowPropertyAux
    variable = permeability
    property = permeability
    execute_on = timestep_end
  []
[]

[ICs]
  [fluid_pressure]
    type = ConstantIC
    variable = ppressure
    value = 101
    block = block1
  []
 []

[Kernels]
  [time_derivative_water]
    type = PorousFlowMassTimeDerivative
    variable = 'ppressure'
  []
  [flux_water]
    type = PorousFlowAdvectiveFlux
    fluid_component = 0
    use_displaced_mesh = false
    variable = 'ppressure'
  []
[]

[Materials]
  [temperature]
    type = PorousFlowTemperature
    temperature = 293.15
    use_displaced_mesh = false
  []
  [saturation]
    type = PorousFlow1PhaseP
    porepressure = 'ppressure'
    capillary_pressure = pc
    block = ' block1 block2' 
  []
  [massfrac]
    type = PorousFlowMassFraction
    block = ' block1 block2' 
  []
  [water_viscosity_density]
    type = PorousFlowSingleComponentFluid
    fp = water
    phase = 0
    block = ' block1 block2' 
  []
  [relperm_water]
    type = PorousFlowRelativePermeabilityCorey
    n = 0.0
    s_res = 0.1
    sum_s_res = 0.5
    phase = 0
    block = ' block1 block2' 
  []
    [porosity_block1]
    type = PorousFlowPorosityConst
    porosity = 0.08
    block = block1
  []
    [porosity_block2]
    type = PorousFlowPorosityConst
    porosity = 1.0
    block = 'block2'
  []
    [porosity_block3]
    type = PorousFlowPorosityConst
    porosity =  0.0                     
    block = 'block3'
  []
    [permeability_block1]
     type = newPerm
     Raw = true
     flow = rotxy_aux
    block = block1
  []
    [permeability_block2]
     type = newPerm
     Raw = true
     flow = rotxy_aux
     block = 'block2'
  []
    [permeability_block3]
     type = newPerm
     Raw = true
     flow = rotxy_aux  
     block = 'block3'
    []

  [elasticity_tensor_block1]
    type = ADComputeIsotropicElasticityTensor                
    youngs_modulus = 2.5e1                  
    poissons_ratio = 0.1
    block = 'block1'
    base_name = RR
 []
  [elasticity_tensor_block2]
    type = ADComputeIsotropicElasticityTensor
    youngs_modulus = 1e11                  
    poissons_ratio = 0.0 
    block = 'block2'
    base_name = RR    
  []
  [elasticity_tensor_block3]
    type = ADComputeIsotropicElasticityTensor
    youngs_modulus = 2.1e19                   
    poissons_ratio =  0.30 
    block = 'block3'
    base_name = RR
  []

  [return_stress]
    type = ADComputeMultipleInelasticStress
    inelastic_models = "new_creep"
    combined_inelastic_strain_weights = '1.0'
  []
  [new_creep]
    type = ADNewCreep
    smin = 1.21e8 
    smax = 1.88e5    
    smin_const = 0.87
    smax_const = 1.21
    block = 'block1 block3 block2'
  []

[Modules/TensorMechanics/Master]
    strain = SMALL
    incremental = true
    add_variables = true
    additional_generate_output = 'stress_yy stress_xx stress_zz creep_strain_xx creep_strain_yy creep_strain_zz elastic_strain_yy'  
    use_automatic_differentiation = true
    base_name = RR
  [block1]
  block = 'block1'
    use_automatic_differentiation = true
  []
  [block2]
   block = 'block2'
   use_automatic_differentiation = true
  []
  [block3]
   block = 'block3'
   use_automatic_differentiation = true
  []
[]
@hugary1995 @GiudGiud

Whatever object is in charge of defining permeability is declaring it with the wrong name.
So that s why you gets tons of “missing property” message. You should use the debug show_materials option to get the names in sync

Yeah, I declared it with the correct name, and I’m back to square one with this error:
*** ERROR ***
The following error occurred in the object "permeability_block1", of type "newPerm".

The requested AD material property 'stress' of type 'RankTwoTensorTempl<double>'
is already retrieved or declared as a non-AD property of type 'RankTwoTensorTempl<double>'.

Probably, the problem is with ADComputeMultipleInelasticStress. I checked the source code and It seems it is not declaring stress as an ADMaterial. I'm certain it is a bug.
@dschwen wrote this object. Could you please comment on the AD-status and needs here?

node.title: Could you guys help me to set a side (boundary)?
node.bodyText:
Hello, Moose experts.
I have difficulty setting a 'top' boundary due to its randomness (or anisotropic surface).
I imported the exodus file from an external meshing utility for the surface roughness.
But I found the boundary condition wasn't applied correctly, due to a not-well-defined boundary.
So, I tried to set a boundary well and tested various options but all failed.
Here is my system.

The green line is the top boundary that I want to set.
I tested by applying voltage (DirichletBC) and the results are below.

The green circles say the boundary has problems.
Here is my input file.
[Mesh]
  construct_side_list_from_node_list = true
  [./fmg]
    type = FileMeshGenerator
    file = './S-roughness-1_in.e'
  []
  [./subdomain]
    type = SubdomainBoundingBoxGenerator
    input = fmg
    bottom_left = '0.01 14.5 0.0'
    top_right = '79.99 25.0 0.0'
    block_id = 1
  []
  [./tt]
    type = SideSetsAroundSubdomainGenerator
    input = subdomain
    normal = '0 1 0'
    new_boundary = 'tt'
    block = 1
#    external_only = true
  []
  [./tl]
    type = SideSetsAroundSubdomainGenerator
    input = tt
    normal = '-1 0 0'
    new_boundary = 'tl'
    block = 1
#    external_only = true
  []
  [./tr]
    type = SideSetsAroundSubdomainGenerator
    input = tl
    normal = '1 0 0'
    new_boundary = 'tr'
    block = 1
#    external_only = true
  []
  [./blk_top]
    type = RenameBoundaryGenerator
    input = tr
    old_boundary = 'tt tl tr'
    new_boundary = 'blk_top blk_top blk_top'
  []

#  [./blk_top]
#    type = BoundingBoxNodeSetGenerator
#    input = fmg
#    new_boundary = 'blk_top'
#    top_right = '80.0 25.0 0.0'
#    bottom_left = '0.0 14.5 0.0'
#  []
  [./blk_bot]
    type = BoundingBoxNodeSetGenerator
    input = blk_top
    new_boundary = 'blk_bot'
    top_right = '80.0 0.01 0.0'
    bottom_left = '0.0 0.0 0.0'
  []
  [./blk_left]
    type = BoundingBoxNodeSetGenerator
    input = blk_bot
    new_boundary = 'blk_left'
    top_right = '0.01 25.0 0.0'
    bottom_left = '-0.01 0.0 0.0'
  []
  [./blk_right]
    type = BoundingBoxNodeSetGenerator
    input = blk_left
    new_boundary = 'blk_right'
    top_right = '80.01 25.0 0.0'
    bottom_left = '79.99 0.0 0.0'
  []
#  [./blk_bot]
#    type = SideSetsAroundSubdomainGenerator
#    block = 5
#    new_boundary = 'blk_bot'
#    normal = '0 -1 0'
#    input = fmg
#  [../]
#  [./blk_top]
#    type = SideSetsAroundSubdomainGenerator
#    block = 5
#    new_boundary = 'blk_top'
#    normal = '0 1 0'
#    input = blk_bot
#  [../]
#
#  [./blk_left]
#    type = SideSetsAroundSubdomainGenerator
#    block = 5
#    new_boundary = 'blk_left'
#    normal = '-1 0 0'
#    input = blk_top
#  [../]
#  [./blk_right]
#    type = SideSetsAroundSubdomainGenerator
#    block = 5
#    new_boundary = 'blk_right'
#    normal = '1 0 0'
#    input = blk_left
#  [../]
[]


[Functions]
  [./bc_func]
    type = PiecewiseLinear
    data_file = './vsweep.csv'
    format = columns
    scale_factor = 1.0
  [../]
[]

[Variables]

  [./V]
    order = FIRST
    family = LAGRANGE
    initial_condition = 0.0
  [../]

[]


[BCs]
  [V_top]
    type = FunctionDirichletBC
    variable = V
    function = bc_func # GND
    boundary = blk_top
  []

  [V_bot]
    type = DirichletBC
    variable = V
    value = 0.0
    boundary = blk_bot
  []

#  [V_left]
#    type = DirichletBC
#    variable = V
#    value = 0.01 # GND
#    boundary = blk_left
#  []
#
#  [V_right]
#    type = DirichletBC
#    variable = V
#    value = 0.0
#    boundary = blk_right
#  []

[]

[Kernels]


  ########## Electrical ###############

  [./Matdiff_sig_del2_V]
    type = MatDiffusion
    variable = V
    diffusivity = 'electrical_conductivity'
  [../]

  ########## Electrical END ###########

[]





[Materials]


  [./electrical_conductivity_TE]
    type = ParsedMaterial
    property_name = 'electrical_conductivity'
    expression = '0.5e-2'
    outputs = exodus
  [../]


[]

[AuxVariables]


  ########### Electric ###########
  [Ex]
    order = CONSTANT
    family = MONOMIAL
  []

  [Ey]
    order = CONSTANT
    family = MONOMIAL
  []

#  [J]
#    family = NEDELEC_ONE
#    order = FIRST
#  []
#
#  [Jy]
#    order = CONSTANT
#    family = MONOMIAL
#  []

  [E_AC_elec]
    order = CONSTANT
    family = MONOMIAL
  []

#  [Jy_times_x]
#    order = CONSTANT
#    family = MONOMIAL
#  []

  ######### Electric END #########

[]


[AuxKernels]

#  [dummy]
#    type = ParsedAux
#    variable = dum_x
#    use_xyzt = true
#    expression = 'x'
#  []

  ########## Electric ##########
  [Ex_aux]
    type = PotentialToFieldAux
    variable = Ex
    gradient_variable = V
    sign = negative
    component = x
  []

  [Ey_aux]
    type = PotentialToFieldAux
    variable = Ey
    gradient_variable = V
    sign = negative
    component = y
  []

#  [current_density]
#    type = CurrentDensity
#    variable = J
#    potential = V
#  []
#
#  [Jy]
#    type = VectorVariableComponentAux
#    variable = Jy
#    vector_variable = J
#    component = y
#  []

[]

[Postprocessors]

[]

[Debug]
  show_var_residual_norms = true
[]

[Preconditioning]
  [./SMP]
    type = SMP
    full = true
  [../]
[]

[Executioner]
  type = Transient
  scheme = bdf2
  solve_type = 'PJFNK'

  petsc_options_iname = '-pc_type -pc_hypre_type'
  petsc_options_value = 'hypre      boomeramg'

  l_max_its = 50
  nl_max_its = 50

  l_tol = 1.0e-4
  nl_rel_tol = 1.0e-8
  nl_abs_tol = 1e-8

  [./TimeStepper]
    type = IterationAdaptiveDT
    growth_factor = 1.5
    cutback_factor = 0.5
    optimal_iterations = 5
    dt = 1e-4
  [../]
  
#  [./Adaptivity]
#    interval = 2
#    refine_fraction = 0.2
#    coarsen_fraction = 0.3
#    max_h_level = 3
#  [../]


  dtmin = 1e-13
  dtmax = 2.5e-2

#  start_time = 0.0
#  end_time = 27.7

########## For TEST ##########
  num_steps = 2
##############################


  automatic_scaling = true
#  compute_scaling_once = false
[]

[Outputs]
  exodus = true
  csv = true
  file_base = output

  [myexo]
    type = Exodus
    file_base = half
    interval = 2
#    start_step = 4340 
  []

  [mymycp]
    type = Checkpoint
    num_files = 10
    interval = 50
    file_base = mycp
  []
[]

Could you guys help me to set a side (top boundary)?
Thank you
Best Wishes,
Jeonghwan

Can you use sidesetsaroundsubdomain with external_only = true?
This can pick up jagged edges.
There's also ParsedGenerateSideset that can do this, once my PR is merged (so it will take a few more days)

Thank you. I will try your suggestion and let you know.
By the way, is it possible to surf the Moose homepage and read some syntax, now?
It was possible about 6 hours ago, but I found it isn't now.
Is it only my problem?

I tried external_only = true and error messages came out.

  [./tt]
    type = SideSetsAroundSubdomainGenerator
    input = subdomain
    normal = '0 1 0'
    new_boundary = 'tt'
    block = 1
    external_only = true
  []
  [./tl]
    type = SideSetsAroundSubdomainGenerator
    input = tt
    normal = '-1 0 0'
    new_boundary = 'tl'
    block = 1
    external_only = true
  []
  [./tr]
    type = SideSetsAroundSubdomainGenerator
    input = tl
    normal = '1 0 0'
    new_boundary = 'tr'
    block = 1
    external_only = true
  []
  [./blk_top]
    type = RenameBoundaryGenerator
    input = tr
    old_boundary = 'tt tl tr'
    new_boundary = 'blk_top blk_top blk_top'
  []

*** ERROR ***
/home2/users/jjh2021/lib/Moose/005_surface_roughness/002_Single/002_RESET/001_roughness1/boundary_test/only_V.i:39: unused parameter 'Mesh/tt/external_only'
/home2/users/jjh2021/lib/Moose/005_surface_roughness/002_Single/002_RESET/001_roughness1/boundary_test/only_V.i:47: unused parameter 'Mesh/tl/external_only'
/home2/users/jjh2021/lib/Moose/005_surface_roughness/002_Single/002_RESET/001_roughness1/boundary_test/only_V.i:55: unused parameter 'Mesh/tr/external_only'





There's also ParsedGenerateSideset that can do this, once my PR is merged (so it will take a few more days)

I read about ParsedGenerateSideset and example files. But I don't think it is a really good solution because It seems like I have to define some analytic function that can be expressed by x,y, and z, and distinguish or separate the region. As you can see, my rough surface is really hard to be expressed by x,y, and z and be separated exactly.

How old is your moose? when did you last update?


You can use a parsed expression that everything verifies, like x > -10000000 and then use the "include_only_external" (once my PR is merged) to just get the external sides

Oh, maybe the version issue. I downloaded the Moose this Feb. Could you tell me how can I update the hpc version Moose? Do I have to download and compile the new version (start from the beginning and PETSc and libMesh building)?


I am sorry but I didn't understand your suggestion. What is PR? I could not find the "include_only_external" option in the ParsedGenerateSideset.

yes that is too old
please follow these instructions for staying up to date
https://mooseframework.inl.gov/moose/getting_started/new_users.html#44fe78f2-40d2-4cda-ad14-4cb3598a2180
If you are using PETSc and libmesh built manually (using the moose/scripts), then do NOT use these instructions.
Instead:
git fetch origin
git rebase origin/master
cd scripts
./update_and_rebuild_libmesh.sh

petsc has not been updated since then

Is it okay to doing next step,
cd scripts
./update_and_rebuild_libmesh.sh

?
No you need to commit your changes before rebasing
Use git commit -a

I followed your suggestion git commit -a and committed all.
After that I rebased it.

node.title: Integral along the boundary
node.bodyText:
Hello,

I have an integral that looks like this. Some of the variables in the integral term vary with time and position. I want to store the result of this integral as a material property[_qp] because it's location related. Or I want to store such integral values at each integral point of the boundary. How can I do to achieve the results I want in MOOSE?
Thanks.

Hello
You can create a material property to do this.
Is your mesh 1D?
Is this integral from the bottom of the mesh to the current location in the element?
Are q2, GP, D, F all variables or material properties or functions?
Guillaume

My mesh is 2D(RZ).
The integral is from the bottom to the current location in the element and I need to store this integral value in every locations(every elem) on boundary.
q2 is material property, GP, D are constant values, F is a function or it can also be a material property.
Thanks.

édit: first you will need to form the intégrand using a ParsedAux
Actually you could try with an auxiliary variable and with a LayeredIntegrzal user object and a SpatialUserOvjectAux to use the user object to fill the variable
then in the LayeredIntegrzl you turn on the cumulative option
this could work for now. You can work with the order of the variable and the number of layers to get a high resolution
Thanks for your answer,  I have solved the problem in this way.

node.title: A 'Density' is not a registered object
node.bodyText:
Hello,
I am trying to run the Thermal Mortar Contact problem (https://mooseframework.inl.gov/modules/combined/tutorials/introduction/step01.html)
I get the following error message:
*** ERROR ***
A 'Density' is not a registered object.
I included TensorMechanics and HeatConduction modules. After searching the documentation, I noticed that Density in mentioned a lot in the "Combined module", so I included it as well. Recompiled with make clobberall, and then make. Still Density is not working.
Should I assume that I should include some other module too? Which? (And how do I determine which modules are needed for each App? e.g. Re. Density, it is not that obvious where to find it).
(I even reinstall everything dev & prebuilt to make sure that everything is compiled correctly!!!)
By the way, the make file didn't have any reference to the Combined module, so I added "Combined := yes" by hand. Shouldnt it be in the list when the Makefile was created by stork?
Thank you for your time!

Hello
Density is part of the miscellaneous module
To find where an object comes from, you can do this in moose/:
find . | grep "Density.C"

or you can use various search features. Or just use the combined module.
There is a "ALL_MODULES" boolean in the Makefile you could have used
Guillaume

Hi Guillaume,
Thank you again for your quick support! Your solution worked (as expected).
Re. ALL_MODULES, I am aware of that, but in the documentation, it says to avoid all modules to include only what's necessary. (In a worst case scenario, I would enable all modules. But for the moment, I 's like to "follow the rules" :) ) In the next case of "missing object", I will search for it with find, as you suggested. (Enabling the Combined module, did not solve the problem).
Sorry for my ignorant questions. MOOSE is a huge framework, and I am trying to adapt.

ah yes I would not recommend all_modules, slows down building quite a bit
no worries

node.title: [PorousFlow] permeability as a function of depth

node.bodyText:
Hello
So you are trying to replace the "file loading" with a function of depth?
Or are you trying to have both dependencies?
For the former, if the dependency is simple, then a ParsedFunction will do it and you can pull in functions in materials.
For the latter, you have the z coordinate in your CSV file right? Could you use that to modify the loaded value by loading the z column and performing the desired operations or is that too coarse?
Guillaume

Hi @GiudGiud it will be the later case, no I do not have z-centroid of the element in the csv, it's assigned based on element ID.
is  there a way to extract z-centroid for each element via MOOSE?
Regards,
Traiwit

you want this during a material property computation right?
there's a _q_point[_qp] attribute usually available when computing or using material properties that is a Point and can be accessed at index 2 to get the z
see the GenericFunctionMaterial code for an example of using coordinates in a material

node.title: Error in running a phase field file
node.bodyText:
Dear all,
Hope you are doing great! I am a new user of MOOSE. Currently, I am coding to simulate phase field. But, while want to run the file, it is showing the following error:
A 'SwitchingFunctionMaterial' is not a registered object.

If you are trying to find this object in a dynamically loaded library, make sure that
the library can be found either in your "Problem/library_path" parameter or in the
MOOSE_LIBRARY_PATH environment variable. 

Would you be kind to let me know what is the problem, and how I can solve the problem!!
I appreciate your help.
Best regards,
Zahid

Hello
Which executable are you using?
You need to be using the phase field module executable, or the executable from an application that includes this module
Guillaume

Dear Dr. Guillaume,
I appreciate your reply. What I am seeing, in the application folder (\wsl.localhost\Ubuntu\home\user\projects\irradiation), there are no modules, though the modules are in the moose folder (\wsl.localhost\Ubuntu\home\user\projects\moose). Unfortunately, the Makefile in the application folder cannot link to the modules of the moose folder. What to do then?
The make file in the application folder look like this:
##############################################################################
################### MOOSE Application Standard Makefile #######################
###############################################################################
#
# Optional Environment variables
# MOOSE_DIR        - Root directory of the MOOSE project
#
###############################################################################
# Use the MOOSE submodule if it exists and MOOSE_DIR is not set
MOOSE_SUBMODULE    := $(CURDIR)/moose
ifneq ($(wildcard $(MOOSE_SUBMODULE)/framework/Makefile),)
  MOOSE_DIR        ?= $(MOOSE_SUBMODULE)
else
  MOOSE_DIR        ?= $(shell dirname `pwd`)/moose
endif

# framework
FRAMEWORK_DIR      := $(MOOSE_DIR)/framework
include $(FRAMEWORK_DIR)/build.mk
include $(FRAMEWORK_DIR)/moose.mk

################################## MODULES ####################################
# To use certain physics included with MOOSE, set variables below to
# yes as needed.  Or set ALL_MODULES to yes to turn on everything (overrides
# other set variables).

ALL_MODULES                 := yes

CHEMICAL_REACTIONS          := no
CONTACT                     := no
ELECTROMAGNETICS            := no
EXTERNAL_PETSC_SOLVER       := no
FLUID_PROPERTIES            := no
FSI                         := no
FUNCTIONAL_EXPANSION_TOOLS  := no
GEOCHEMISTRY                := no
HEAT_CONDUCTION             := no
LEVEL_SET                   := no
MISC                        := no
NAVIER_STOKES               := no
OPTIMIZATION                := no
PERIDYNAMICS                := no
PHASE_FIELD                 := no
POROUS_FLOW                 := no
RAY_TRACING                 := no
REACTOR                     := no
RDG                         := no
RICHARDS                    := no
STOCHASTIC_TOOLS            := no
THERMAL_HYDRAULICS          := no
TENSOR_MECHANICS            := no
XFEM                        := no

include $(MOOSE_DIR)/modules/modules.mk
###############################################################################

# dep apps
APPLICATION_DIR    := $(CURDIR)
APPLICATION_NAME   := irradiation
BUILD_EXEC         := yes
GEN_REVISION       := no
include            $(FRAMEWORK_DIR)/app.mk

###############################################################################
# Additional special case targets should be added here

I am using the command: ./irradiation-opt -i irradiation.i   to run the file. So irradiation-opt should be the executable. Am I right!
Thanks,
Zahid
I think you need to change PHASE FIELD from no to yes in the Makefile in your application, and then recompile. It should be able to find it after that.
Exactly that. You may need to make clobberall before re-make-ing.

Thank you guys for helping me out. Last time, I have given ALL_MODULES := yes. It should turn on all the modules as instructed in the MOOSE help. In addition, this time also made PHASE_FIELD := yes. What I found the same file runs on the first try, but may not run on the second try. I am using WSL shell command. I am not exactly sure what is happening. I am thinking of bugs in the compiler!!
Do you have any comments on that!

node.title: Quick question on redefining blocks/nodesets/sidesets with MOOSE
node.bodyText:
I use gmsh primarily for meshing but discovered that with local refinement some "physical groups" aka block names disappear because they are not tied to the locations in space. So I'm looking for a fix for that.
I saw someone defining a boundary with MOOSE on another question and was wondering if that would be useful for my case. For example, if I have an existing mesh with no blocks defined (or "wrong" blocks defined), can I use some inbuilt MOOSE functions to redefine them?
For example, I found "SubdomainBoundingBoxGenerator" which, if I understand correctly, takes the lower left and upper right coordinates and assigns all elements within the cubic/3d rectaungular "box" defined by those points to a new subdomain ID you can define?
Can you also do the same for more complex geometries? Say, 3D triangles?
What about for surfaces? In one of the input file examples, I saw "ParsedGenerateSideset" where it seems like the area was defined with a parsed mathematical function. So, for example, would a plane rectangular surface on the top be "(z=0) & (x>0) & (x<x_len) & (y>0) & (y<ylen)"?
Also, I found "ParsedGenerateSideSet" accidentally while looking through an example input file. I can't seem to find a list of all available options here, I tried using the url and went to "https://mooseframework.inl.gov/source/meshgenerators/" to find a list of them but got a 403 Forbidden error.
Another related question is on mesh refinement. Can you use the parsed generate sideset (or something else) to define a "block", and then use the mesh refinement option to refine that block alone?

Hello
Blocks / physical groups should not disappear in the first place. Especially not with mesh refinement.
You can use MOOSE redefine blocks in a number of ways. Please have a look at the subdomain generating mesh generators:
https://mooseframework.inl.gov/syntax/Mesh/index.html
You can use parsed expressions for more complex geometries. You can also just create your own mesh generator to do it.
A rectangular plane on top could be:
"(z=${top}) & (x>0) & (x<x_len) & (y>0) & (y<ylen)"?

but be careful with the equality of floating point numbers. Use this instead:
"(z>${top}-1e-8) & (z<${top}+1e-8) & (x>0) & (x<x_len) & (y>0) & (y<ylen)"?

You can use the RefineBlockGenerator to refine a single block
Guillaume

Awesome, thanks! And yeah the problem with blocks disappearing is an issue with gmsh, not MOOSE. (https://gitlab.onelab.info/gmsh/gmsh/-/issues/1786)
Also, another question: If existing blocks are already defined, and there is partial overlap with newly created blocks in MOOSE, will the MOOSE blocks override the former? Say, an existing block from an external meshing software is a sphere partially cutting into a rectangular box, and the sphere is defined as a block. If you assign an ID in MOOSE to all elements within the rectangular box (thus, including parts of the sphere), how does it handle that? Can you tell it to ignore original block IDs?
Also, will you also be required to assign an ID to the part of the sphere that isn't within the rectangular block or will it just be assumed that any block not explicitly defined belongs to the whole mesh? (i.e, any kernels and materials that don't have the block specified will act on that part)?
Yes the later generators take precedence for renaming blocks unless there is a specific parameter to override that (like exclude_subdomain_id)

node.title: Adding a second physics module does not work
node.bodyText:
Hello everyone,
I am trying to find my way in MOOSE following the Tutorials. I completed the TensorMechanics Module, and proceeded to Contact. My problem is that the app is not running; I get the following error:
... section '[Contact]' does not have an associated "Action".
Steps sor far:

I created an app using stork
Enabled the TensorMechanics module and performed "make".
I followed all steps of the TensorMechanics Tutorial - so far so good.
I enabled the Contact module in the Makefile and performed "make" again. It compile without problems. (If I run make again, it makes no new compilations, so I guess that the compilation has been successful).
I follow the Contact tutorial (https://mooseframework.inl.gov/modules/contact/tutorials/introduction/step01.html). I even copy/pasted the code to make sure that there is no typo in my code.
I get the error mentioned above (... section '[Contact]' does not have an associated "Action".)

Furthermore, VS Code does not recognise Contact for AutoCompletion; not even for the "[Contact]" (Autocomplete works fine for TensorMechanics).
What am I doing wrong? How shoule I "inform" the app that I need a new module in my app?
Any advice is most welcome!!
Thank you
Update: I tries to "process" the app using peacock. I get the following warning in the console:
WARNING
Could not create /Contact

Hello
TensorMechanics does not depend on Contact, Contact depends on TM.
So you can run TM simulations with the Contact module executable, but no Contact simulation with the TM executable
So you need to enable both, like you did in 2 then in 4, unfortunately you built in 2, and it will not pick it up until you clean and rebuild.
so
make clobberall
make

in your storked application
Guillaume

Hi, Thank you for your prompt response!
When I rebuilt (Step 4), the executable had a recent creation date (few seconds ago), so I assumed that a correct re-compilation took place.
I did an update of moose (git fetch origin, rebase origin/master), and then make. It recompiled and worked without out of the box.
I guess that when I updated the code, it was forced to recompile everything, as you suggested.
Now everything works as expected.
